public class LayerDefinition extends Object

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    AutoLayerRuleGroup[]
    getAutoRuleGroups()
    Contains all the auto-layer rule definitions.
    Long
    getAutoSourceLayerDefUid()
     
    Long
    getAutoTilesetDefUid()
    **WARNING**: this deprecated value is no longer exported since version 1.2.0 Replaced by: `tilesetDefUid`
    boolean
    getCanSelectWhenInactive()
    Allow editor selections when the layer is not currently active.
    double
    getDisplayOpacity()
    Opacity of the layer (0 to 1.0)
    String
    getDoc()
    User defined documentation for this element to provide help/tips to level designers.
    String[]
    getExcludedTags()
    An array of tags to forbid some Entities in this layer
    long
    getGridSize()
    Width and height of the grid in pixels
    long
    getGuideGridHei()
    Height of the optional "guide" grid in pixels
    long
    getGuideGridWid()
    Width of the optional "guide" grid in pixels
    boolean
    getHideFieldsWhenInactive()
     
    boolean
    getHideInList()
    Hide the layer from the list on the side of the editor view.
    String
    getIdentifier()
    User defined unique identifier
    double
    getInactiveOpacity()
    Alpha of this layer when it is not the active one.
    IntGridValueDefinition[]
    getIntGridValues()
    An array that defines extra optional info for each IntGrid value.
    WARNING: the array order is not related to actual IntGrid values! As user can re-order IntGrid values freely, you may value "2" before value "1" in this array.
    Type
    getLayerDefinitionType()
    Type of the layer as Haxe Enum Possible values: `IntGrid`, `Entities`, `Tiles`, `AutoLayer`
    double
    getParallaxFactorX()
    Parallax horizontal factor (from -1 to 1, defaults to 0) which affects the scrolling speed of this layer, creating a fake 3D (parallax) effect.
    double
    getParallaxFactorY()
    Parallax vertical factor (from -1 to 1, defaults to 0) which affects the scrolling speed of this layer, creating a fake 3D (parallax) effect.
    boolean
    getParallaxScaling()
    If true (default), a layer with a parallax factor will also be scaled up/down accordingly.
    long
    getPxOffsetX()
    X offset of the layer, in pixels (IMPORTANT: this should be added to the `LayerInstance` optional offset)
    long
    getPxOffsetY()
    Y offset of the layer, in pixels (IMPORTANT: this should be added to the `LayerInstance` optional offset)
    boolean
    getRenderInWorldView()
    If TRUE, the content of this layer will be used when rendering levels in a simplified way for the world view
    String[]
    getRequiredTags()
    An array of tags to filter Entities that can be added to this layer
    double
    getTilePivotX()
    If the tiles are smaller or larger than the layer grid, the pivot value will be used to position the tile relatively its grid cell.
    double
    getTilePivotY()
    If the tiles are smaller or larger than the layer grid, the pivot value will be used to position the tile relatively its grid cell.
    Long
    getTilesetDefUid()
    Reference to the default Tileset UID being used by this layer definition.
    **WARNING**: some layer *instances* might use a different tileset.
    String
    getType()
    Type of the layer (*IntGrid, Entities, Tiles or AutoLayer*)
    String
    getUIColor()
    User defined color for the UI
    long
    getUid()
    Unique Int identifier

    • getIntGridValues

      public IntGridValueDefinition[] getIntGridValues()
      An array that defines extra optional info for each IntGrid value.
      WARNING: the array order is not related to actual IntGrid values! As user can re-order IntGrid values freely, you may value "2" before value "1" in this array.

    • setIntGridValues

      public void setIntGridValues(IntGridValueDefinition[] value)

    • getParallaxFactorX

      public double getParallaxFactorX()
      Parallax horizontal factor (from -1 to 1, defaults to 0) which affects the scrolling speed of this layer, creating a fake 3D (parallax) effect.

    • setParallaxFactorX

      public void setParallaxFactorX(double value)

    • getParallaxFactorY

      public double getParallaxFactorY()
      Parallax vertical factor (from -1 to 1, defaults to 0) which affects the scrolling speed of this layer, creating a fake 3D (parallax) effect.

    • setParallaxFactorY

      public void setParallaxFactorY(double value)

    • getParallaxScaling

      public boolean getParallaxScaling()
      If true (default), a layer with a parallax factor will also be scaled up/down accordingly.

    • setParallaxScaling

      public void setParallaxScaling(boolean value)

    • getPxOffsetX

      public long getPxOffsetX()
      X offset of the layer, in pixels (IMPORTANT: this should be added to the `LayerInstance` optional offset)

    • setPxOffsetX

      public void setPxOffsetX(long value)

    • getPxOffsetY

      public long getPxOffsetY()
      Y offset of the layer, in pixels (IMPORTANT: this should be added to the `LayerInstance` optional offset)

    • setPxOffsetY

      public void setPxOffsetY(long value)

    • getRenderInWorldView

      public boolean getRenderInWorldView()
      If TRUE, the content of this layer will be used when rendering levels in a simplified way for the world view

    • setRenderInWorldView

      public void setRenderInWorldView(boolean value)

    • getRequiredTags

      public String[] getRequiredTags()
      An array of tags to filter Entities that can be added to this layer

    • setRequiredTags

      public void setRequiredTags(String[] value)

    • getTilePivotX

      public double getTilePivotX()
      If the tiles are smaller or larger than the layer grid, the pivot value will be used to position the tile relatively its grid cell.

    • setTilePivotX

      public void setTilePivotX(double value)

    • getTilePivotY

      public double getTilePivotY()
      If the tiles are smaller or larger than the layer grid, the pivot value will be used to position the tile relatively its grid cell.

    • setTilePivotY

      public void setTilePivotY(double value)

    • getTilesetDefUid

      public Long getTilesetDefUid()
      Reference to the default Tileset UID being used by this layer definition.
      **WARNING**: some layer *instances* might use a different tileset. So most of the time, you should probably use the `__tilesetDefUid` value found in layer instances.
      Note: since version 1.0.0, the old `autoTilesetDefUid` was removed and merged into this value.

    • setTilesetDefUid

      public void setTilesetDefUid(Long value)

    • getLayerDefinitionType

      public Type getLayerDefinitionType()
      Type of the layer as Haxe Enum Possible values: `IntGrid`, `Entities`, `Tiles`, `AutoLayer`

      public void setLayerDefinitionType(Type value)
